titleStmt.title: Revisions to Henry David Thoreau's manuscript of Walden

publicationStmt.p: Final Project for ENGL 340, Literature and Literary Study in the Digital Age, Spring 2020, SUNY Geneseo.

sourceDesc.bibl: A page from HM 924, the manuscript of Walden, "Higher Laws", Paragraph 1, Version E

zone.note: The First paragraph in the Higher Laws chapter of Walden give insight to Thoreau's mental health while living in the woods - many of the revisions he makes in this chapter are afterthoughts written in pencil, often times justifiying his actions in the sentence prior. Throughout this section, Thoreau also makes revisions to make the text applicable to a more generalized population, hence the title "Higher Laws" - he is arguing that what he is outlying is are the higher governing laws of nature and man.
